abstract.t: IP Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) provide connectivity between sites across an IP backbone. These VPNs can be supported using BGP/MPLS and the connections can be created by using MPLS Traffic Engineered (TE) Label Switched Paths (LSPs). In order to support multiple MPLS-TE based BGP/MPLS IP-VPNs that are interconnected via the same Provider Edge (PE) routers, new RSVP extensions are required. This document does not define new protocol extensions for Internet Standardization. The document is intended to be informational and documents a solution for interconnecting multiple BGP/IP-VPNs via the same PE router.
